# Simple Uptime Command

## Import Code
```

```
## Installation

Once you've imported the code all you need to do is tie a command to the imported action. If you are offline, no message should appear however should you wish to create something in this case in the `if statement` change the `do nothing` to the action you wish to happen.

## C# Uptime Code

## Import Code
```

```
## Installation

Once imported you will have imported a `!uptime` commands too, so if you have a duplicate you will need to delete, disable or change one of them if you don't want a 2 actions to run at the same time. The references should of imported with the code but if not, you will need to add 
```
system.Linq.dll
```
If all that is done then your uptime command should be set-up you will just need to edit the output message to your specifications.

> By design this is built to not output anything if the broadcaster is offline, if you wish to have something happen notes have been added to the C#, but if you don't know what you are doing ask in discord for support. Edit codes at your own risk. {.is-danger}

## Configurarion
In the output message you can put the following variables and for `1 hour 30 mins and 20 secs` they will output as follows
- `%uptime.secs%` = 20
- `%uptime.mins%` = 30
- `%uptime.hours%` = 1
- `%uptime.days%` = 0
- `%uptime.totalsecs%` = 5420
- `%uptime.totalmins%` = 90
- `%uptime.totalhours%`  = 1
- `%uptime.totaldays%` = 0

So just edit a `Twitch Send Message` Sub-action so it Outputs how you wish.
